text:
fixes #415.

I removed doc/COPYING because I didn't see the point compared to COPYING and used nilearn developers everywhere else.

One thing I didn't do is tackle @yarioptic's following comment:

> and would be neat if at least briefly copyright/licenses of used/shipped 3rd party modules were mentioned in COPYING:

the main reason being that scikit-learn doesn't do it so I don't have a good model to draw inspiration from. Suggestions more than welcome.
title: Tidy up copyrights

title: Pull request merge from lesteve/nilearn:tidy-copyrights to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: To address @yarikoptic's comment, we should list all the code that we have included and that came from outside in the copying, with a pointer to the license. I can only see nilearn/doc/sphinxext
clean_text: To address yarikopt comment list code includ came outsid copi pointer licens I see nilearndocsphinxext

text:
Right I added licenses for all the incorporated software I could find via `git grep -iPl 'license|copyright'`.

I drew inspiration from the Sphinx [LICENSE](https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/blob/master/LICENSE).

While I was at it I rename COPYING to LICENSE.

text: Thank you! This is great. Merging!
